supporting.text: Jackson Pollock was known to struggle with alcoholism throughout his life, which contradicts the straight edge lifestyle of abstaining from alcohol.

attacks.text: Jackson Pollock was known to struggle with alcoholism throughout his life, which contradicts the straight edge lifestyle of abstaining from alcohol.
Pollock's alcoholism is well-documented, but the straight edge movement did not exist during his lifetime (1912-1956), so the label cannot apply retroactively.
While the term 'straight edge' is modern, the concept of abstaining from alcohol has existed for centuries, so Pollock's behavior can still be evaluated against it.
Some accounts suggest Pollock had periods of sobriety, meaning he may not have been consistently alcoholic.
Pollock's documented relapses and drunken death prove his alcoholism was a defining trait, not an occasional lapse.
